title: Double slit - difr grating - find d and lambda

content.question: Show all your work for each part of the question. The parts within the question may not have equal weight. A group of students have a laser of known wavelength <math alttext="lambda sub K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mi>K</mi></msub></math> and a thin sheet that has two narrow, parallel slits, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The students wish to determine the spacing <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> between the slits, which is too small to be measured with a ruler. (a) Describe an experimental procedure using the laser that would allow the students to determine the value of <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math> by making a linear graph. Include steps necessary to reduce experimental uncertainty.

With the laser beam from the second laser normally incident on the grating, diffracted beams are observed on a semicircular screen that has the grating at its center.
